title: "WHAAAM" Pop Art Type
content:
Any ideas on what a good match might be for this kind of feel?

Rob

author: Rob Sutton

comments.content:
If you need comic book fonts there’s two places to go, but they might look too “modern”.

[Blambot](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410224019/http:/www.blambot.com/) | [Comic Book Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410224019/http:/www.comicbookfonts.com/)

<cite>Any ideas on what a good match might be for this kind of feel?</cite>

A pen and paper?

- Lex
Just a note: When you go to Blambot note the license for the “free” fonts. It restricts commercial use for the average user.
